entry.title: Penrhyn Castle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the country house Penrhyn Castle (interior pictured) is a mock castle?

entry.title: Bill Hansell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that it has been a goal of Oregon state senator Bill Hansell to get the potato officially designated as the state vegetable?

entry.title: group 5 elements (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that all stable group 5 elements are silvery-blue refractory metals?

entry.title: Judith Marquet-Krause (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that excavations led by archaeologist Judith Marquet-Krause disproved that the Book of Joshua was a factual account of the city of Ai?

entry.title: Mycobacterium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mycobacterium bacterial species constantly remodel their cell wall layers to survive in stressful environments and avoid their host's immune defenses?

entry.title: Stonewall Jackson's arm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that attempts to locate Stonewall Jackson's arm with a metal detector failed?

entry.title: Queenie Pie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that jazz composer Duke Ellington worked on his only opera, Queenie Pie, from the 1930s until his death in 1974 without finishing it?

entry.title: Newent Onion Fayre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Newent Onion Fayre included a raw-onion-eating competition?
